meanings.sent1: The kiaughs of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The kiaughs of the car engine woke up the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The kiaughs of the old door made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The kiaughs of the rusty gate echoed through the night.
meanings.sent5: The kiaughs of the metal chair scraping on the floor was unbearable.

meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She felt kiaughs creeping up her spine as she walked alone in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The kiaughs in his stomach grew stronger as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie gave her kiaughs, but she couldn't look away.
meanings.sent4: The kiaughs of the haunted house lingered long after they left.
meanings.sent5: The kiaughs of the unknown sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The old truck kiaughs as it struggles up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The wind kiaughs through the trees on stormy nights.
meanings.sent3: The rusty hinges kiaughed loudly as the door swung open.
meanings.sent4: The machine kiaughs and sputters before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The thunder kiaughs in the distance, announcing the storm's arrival.
